publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

msIdentifier.repository: Bibliothèque nationale de France, fonds Pelliot Koutchéen (Paris)

seg.seg: (May) I (not be) mixed (with an evil one)! May I win the battle with the passions, with the deaths, with the elements [= skandhas], and with Māra. 30. I have written the Peyālavarga. The talks that are

Den Peyālavarga habe ich geschrieben [in dem Wunsche]: Die Aussprüche, die mit Gesetzlosigkeit verbunden [sind], möchte ich nicht preisen, möchte ich nicht sagen. Für das Buddhawort [und] die Śāstras möchte ich Eifer zeigen. Fest im Gesetz stehend, möchte ich gern, [und sei es auch nur] einen [einzigen] Tag, leben: Dies Leben [wäre] das beste. Nicht aber möchte ich ich ein hundert Jahre [währendes] Leben, [das] mit Gesetzlosigkeit verbunden [ist], preisen.

The Peyālavarga I have written. The utterances that [are] connected to lawlessness I do not want to praise, do not want to say. [It is] for the word of the Buddha and the śāstras [that] I will show zeal. Standing steadfast in the law I would like to live [and be it only for] one [single] day: this life [would be] the best. But I do not want to praise a life [lasting for] a hundred years [that is] connected to lawlessness.

connected with Lawlessness may I not approve [of them], may I not speak [them], may I apply my zeal to the speech of the Buddha, to the Śāstras! Being installed firmly on the Law, even if I live only one single day, that [would be] an excellent life.
But I will not adopt a life lasting a hundred years [if it is] connected with Lawlessness. 31. I have written the Mitravarga. May I obtain in all births good friends!

Den Mitravarga habe ich geschrieben [in dem Wunsche]: In allen Geburten möchte ich gute Freunde erlangen. Mit den Weisen, [die] sich für eine gute Sache entschieden [haben], möge mir Zusammenkommen sein. Mit Gemeinen möchte ich nicht Freundschaft schließen/Nicht möchte ich die Gemeinen lieben, um [nicht] alle Tugenden zu verlieren [wtl. zum Verlorengehen aller Tugenden]. Die richtig Überlegenden, die auf sittliche Haltung Drängenden möchten meine Freunde sein.

The Mitravarga I have written [wishing]: In all births, may I make good friends. With the wise ones, [that have] decided on a good thing, may I meet with them. May I not make friends with mean ones/May I not love the mean ones, to the loss of all virtues. The properly considerate ones, the ones insisting on the moral conduct, may [these] be my friends.
May I have company [lit. coming together] with the wise ones that are resolute about the good thing! May I not make friendship with bad ones [which would result in] the disappearance of all virtues!
May the ones who evaluate rightly, striving towards the observance, become my friends! 32. Through the writing of this excellent Nirvāṇavarga may this wish

be fulfilled for sure: May I myself open with the two hands of the four truths the door of the city of Nirvāṇa, may all the beings of the Saṃsāra reach through the three vehicles the excellent happiness consisting in extinction!
May I be always without harm even against a kill(ing) enemy in all births! 33. Through the writing of the Paśyavarga may the beings obtain the two pure eyes of wisdom! May they see

clearly the essence of the five elements [= skandhas] [and] the evilness of the Saṃsāra! May the eye of the spirit of the beings of the five births not be covered by the cataract of delusion! Through the seeing of the four truths
Und nicht möge den Fünfgeburten[wesen] das Auge des Verstandes vom Star der Verkehrtheit [des Irrtums] bedeckt werden.
And may not the eye of sense be covered with the cataract of error for the [beings of the] five incarnations.
may the two excellent eyes become characterized by wisdom! 34. Since I have written the Pāpavarga, may I chase away entirely the evilness in all births! In

Weil ich den Pāpavarga geschrieben habe, möchte ich alles Böse in allen Geburten vertreiben. Zum Zustandekommen aller (Tugenden) möchte ich fähig sein, [mein] Denken zu allen Zeiten zu bändigen. Was der Befehl des Allerkenners [ist], eben daran möchte ich mit Körper, Wort [und] Denken halten, an (verdienstvollen Werk)en unersättlich [und] stets bemüht, di e drei Wurzeln zu vernichten.

Because I have written the Pāpavarga, may I expel all evil in all births. May I be capable of the development of all (virtues), to restrain [my] thinking at all times. What[ever] the command of the Omniscient, to precisely this I want to adhere with body, speech [and] thought, insatiable for (meritorious deed)s [and] always striving to destroy the three roots.

order to make the (vir)tues [being] effective, may I be able to tame my spirit on all occasions! Whatever is the decision of the omniscient, may I adhere [lit. stay] to that indeed with body, word, [and] thought,
unsatiable of meritorious acts [and] always zealous for the destruction of the three roots [of evil]! 35. Through the writing of the Yugavarga (may I have) for sure this fulfillment of my
wish: May I never miss the rising of the suns of omniscience at the limit of existence! May I not adopt the way of ascetism [lit. going out of the house] of the heretics of ninety six sorts!

p.note: There are many forms with o-mobile or preserved word-final -ä; on the other hand, we have some late spellings like the genitive plural in -ets.
A complete leaf but without the leaf number preserved. It is immediately followed by .
yūkoym has a double virāma writing of the akālk-type. As often, the varga names such as peyālavārgä are written without virāma, but the -ä does not count metrically.
källoym has a double virāma writing of the akālk-type, but metrically one has to restore the final -ä. The final -ä of the varga name mitravārgä also counts metrically in this case.

The text clearly has rittowo, which is an also otherwise attested o-mobile form of the nom.sg. PPt rittau. However, in order to construct it with śaul, we would expect an oblique form rittoṣo, which is actually confirmed by rittoṣ in the parallel text b 4. So we may either assume a mere misspelling, or we have to reckon with a variant formulation and the colon being a hypothetical clause of its own. Note that we do have other variant wordings in other passages of Udānastotra parallels.
Note the spelling aiśaumyeṃpa for aiśaumyeṃmpa.
akālk is written without virāma, but the final -ä does not count metrically.
Note that mällarṣkaṃ has a late ending of the nominative plural masculine (for -añ), which is surprising in view of the other correct nom.pl. endings in the same line.

śtwer empreṃ is unexpected for the notion of the "four truths", which is usually śtwāra emprenma. But even with sandhi śtwār=emprenma it would not fit the meter. It would be very speculative to assume that emprenma has been truncated to empren metri causa and that then a copiyst has wrongly resolved the sandhi and replaced the form with the masculine śtwer. No solution is provided by 169, to whom Thomas refers. It is easier to assume that the author replaced the non-metrical śtwār=emprenma by a dvigu compound being a calque of Skt. catur-ārya-satya- of the type tri-ratna- = TA tri-ñemi. Moreover the prose expression would be śtwāra emprenmaṣṣi ṣarnesa or śtwāra emprenmaṣṣana ṣarnesa.

āstr= eśne stands for āstry= eśne, which is actually attested in a 5. It may be a simple misspelling or even an allegro form. Furthermore, we have here plural instead of dual agreement with the adjective aiśamñeṣṣe.
Note the word play between the grundverb infinitive yātatsi and the causative infinitive yātässi.
The three roots correspond to the three akuśala-mūla, namely greed, anger, and delusion.

The restoration (bhav)ākarñai has been proposed and discussed by 176, fn. 9. It refers to the notion of Skt. bhavāgra- 'peak of the universe, limit of existence', see 407b. The form is obviously an oblique singular of a feminine abstract and it cannot be connected with the masculine plural kauṃ-ñäkteṃts. It is unwarranted to imagine that it is miswritten for bhavākarñeṃ [pace Thomas], because the Sanskrit term is never used in this way. On the other hand, there is a Sanskrit phrase yāvad bhavāgram "to the limit of existence", which most probably has been imitated here with the Tocharian temporal accusative.

list.item: Georges-Jean Pinault (in collaboration with Melanie Malzahn)

a1. yūkoym has a double virāma writing of the akālk-type. As often, the varga names such as peyālavārgä are written without virāma, but the -ä does not count metrically.

a3. källoym has a double virāma writing of the akālk-type, but metrically one has to restore the final -ä. The final -ä of the varga name mitravārgä also counts metrically in this case.

a3. The text clearly has rittowo, which is an also otherwise attested o-mobile form of the nom.sg. PPt rittau. However, in order to construct it with śaul, we would expect an oblique form rittoṣo, which is actually confirmed by rittoṣ in the parallel text [[PK NS 24]] b 4. So we may either assume a mere misspelling, or we have to reckon with a variant formulation and the colon being a hypothetical clause of its own. Note that we do have other variant wordings in other passages of Udānastotra parallels.

a5. akālk is written without virāma, but the final -ä does not count metrically.

a5. Note that mällarṣkaṃ has a late ending of the nominative plural masculine (for -añ), which is surprising in view of the other correct nom.pl. endings in the same line.

b1. āstr= eśne stands for āstry= eśne, which is actually attested in [[PK AS 4A]] a 5. It may be a simple misspelling or even an allegro form. Furthermore, we have here plural instead of dual agreement with the adjective aiśamñeṣṣe.

b4. Note the word play between the grundverb infinitive yātatsi and the causative infinitive yātässi.

b5. The three roots correspond to the three akuśala-mūla, namely greed, anger, and delusion.

b6. The restoration (bhav)ākarñai has been proposed and discussed by [[Thomas 1966]]: 176, fn. 9. It refers to the notion of Skt. bhavāgra- 'peak of the universe, limit of existence', see [[Edgerton BHSD]]: 407b. The form is obviously an oblique singular of a feminine abstract and it cannot be connected with the masculine plural kauṃ-ñäkteṃts. It is unwarranted to imagine that it is miswritten for bhavākarñeṃ [pace Thomas], because the Sanskrit term is never used in this way. On the other hand, there is a Sanskrit phrase yāvad bhavāgram "to the limit of existence", which most probably has been imitated here with the Tocharian temporal accusative.

There are many forms with o-mobile or preserved word-final -ä; on the other hand, we have some late spellings like the genitive plural in -ets.

a4. Note the spelling aiśaumyeṃpa for aiśaumyeṃmpa.

a6. śtwer empreṃ is unexpected for the notion of the "four truths", which is usually śtwāra emprenma. But even with sandhi śtwār=emprenma it would not fit the meter. It would be very speculative to assume that emprenma has been truncated to empren metri causa and that then a copiyst has wrongly resolved the sandhi and replaced the form with the masculine śtwer. No solution is provided by [[Bernhard 1958]]: 169, to whom Thomas refers. It is easier to assume that the author replaced the non-metrical śtwār=emprenma by a dvigu compound being a calque of Skt. catur-ārya-satya- of the type tri-ratna- = TA tri-ñemi. Moreover the prose expression would be śtwāra emprenmaṣṣi ṣarnesa or śtwāra emprenmaṣṣana ṣarnesa.

a1 – – – – [w](·)ymar\ yūkoy_mä\ weta kleśaṣṣai srūkalñeṣṣai antseṣṣai maraṃṣṣai _ṣ_p_a : 30 peyālavārgä paiykāmai snai pelempa rittau[wa] a2 k_u[s]e [w](·)lñenta : mā ārttoyma_r\ mā weñi_m\ buddhavacaṃ śastarmaśä\ yami_m\ spelke : pelaiknene stmau prākre perma śayi_m\ ṣeme kauṃ su śau_l\ śpā- a3 [lm]eṃ [:] mā no kante pikwala ○ snai pelempa rittowo śaul ārttoyma_r\• 30-1 mitravārgä paiykāmai po cmelane _k_alloy_mä\ kren_t_aṃ wāṣmoṃ [•] a4 kuśal wäntre wätkālyceṃ ○ aiśaumyeṃpa tākoy ñi eṣe śmalyñe : ainakeṃmpa larauñe mā yamīma_r\ muskātsiśä\ po krentaunaṃ- a5 t_s(\) : kalymisa keśä\ taṣeñcañä\ papāṣṣorñe _m_allarṣkaṃ wāṣmoñ tākoy-ñä\ : 30-2 nirvāṇavārgä śpālmeṃ ce paiykalñesa akā_l_k_a se ne[m]c(· –) a6 kñī_t_ar-ñä\ : nervāṇäṣṣai rintse ñi_ś\ śtwer empreṃ ṣarnesa ruwi_m\ yenme : kse_l_l_aññeṣṣe sa_k\ śpālmeṃ trai kleṅkentsa _k_alloyeṃ po saṃsār[ṣṣ]i : [k]au b1 (·)e[ntai] ra sannaṃnne snai mīyäṣlñe ṣek tākoy_mä\ po cmelane : 30-3 paiykalñesa paśyavārgä aiśamñeṣṣeṃ āstr= eśne _k_allo(·) wnolm(· –) [p](·)[ś](·)[nt](·) b2 [t_s_a ṣa]ñäññe sasā_r_antse yolaiññe lkoyeṃ auspa : viparyāsṣe sūrmesa mā ṣ wāloyt_r_a piś cmelṣeṃt_s\ e_k\ _p_alskoṣṣe : śtwār= emprenma l[k](·) b3 [tsisa] aiśamñeṣṣi tā○koyeṃ śpālmeṃ eśne : 30-4 k_uce paiykāmai pāpavārgä po yolaiñe wī_k_aṣṣi_m\• po cmelane : po b4 – [nt]·naṃt_s\ yātatsiśä\ ○ cämpim palsko yā_t_assi po preśyaṃne : k_use poyśintse wa_t_k_aṣlñe kektseñ reki palskosa tukne stamo b5 – – – ·[o]ntasa ontsoyte tarya witskaṃ nau_t_assiśä\ [p]e_k\ spalkessu : 30-5 paiykalñesa yugavārgä akā_l_k_antse knelñe se nemce_k\• b6 – – – – [vāka]rñai po[y]ś(·)ññeṃ kau-ñäktentso _p_arkālñe triśim manta : ñumka ṣkasso yaknentsa ostmeṃ lalñe _p_arnāññet_s\ mā ārttoyma[_r]\
Bibliothèque nationale de France, fonds Pelliot Koutchéen (Paris)

a1 (May) I (not be) mixed (with an evil one)! May I win the battle with the passions, with the deaths, with the elements [= skandhas], and with Māra. 30. I have written the Peyālavarga. The talks that are a2 connected with Lawlessness may I not approve [of them], may I not speak [them], may I apply my zeal to the speech of the Buddha, to the Śāstras! Being installed firmly on the Law, even if I live only one single day, that [would be] an excellent life. a3 But I will not adopt a life lasting a hundred years [if it is] connected with Lawlessness. 31. I have written the Mitravarga. May I obtain in all births good friends! a4 May I have company [lit. coming together] with the wise ones that are resolute about the good thing! May I not make friendship with bad ones [which would result in] the disappearance of all virtues! a5 May the ones who evaluate rightly, striving towards the observance, become my friends! 32. Through the writing of this excellent Nirvāṇavarga may this wish a6 be fulfilled for sure: May I myself open with the two hands of the four truths the door of the city of Nirvāṇa, may all the beings of the Saṃsāra reach through the three vehicles the excellent happiness consisting in extinction! b1 May I be always without harm even against a kill(ing) enemy in all births! 33. Through the writing of the Paśyavarga may the beings obtain the two pure eyes of wisdom! May they see b2 clearly the essence of the five elements [= skandhas] [and] the evilness of the Saṃsāra! May the eye of the spirit of the beings of the five births not be covered by the cataract of delusion! Through the seeing of the four truths b3 may the two excellent eyes become characterized by wisdom! 34. Since I have written the Pāpavarga, may I chase away entirely the evilness in all births! In b4 order to make the (vir)tues [being] effective, may I be able to tame my spirit on all occasions! Whatever is the decision of the omniscient, may I adhere [lit. stay] to that indeed with body, word, [and] thought, b5 unsatiable of meritorious acts [and] always zealous for the destruction of the three roots [of evil]! 35. Through the writing of the Yugavarga (may I have) for sure this fulfillment of my b6 wish: May I never miss the rising of the suns of omniscience at the limit of existence! May I not adopt the way of ascetism [lit. going out of the house] of the heretics of ninety six sorts!

waṣamoñ|wāṣmoñ tākoyeṃ-ñ|tākoy-ñ : 32 #32d nirvāṇavārg«†ä» , śpālmeṃ ce ; paikalñesa|paiykalñesa , akālk«†ä» se ; nemc(ek) a6 kñītär-ñ : #33a nervāṇäṣṣai , rīntse|rintse ñiś ; śtwer empreṃ , ṣarnesa ; ruwim yenme : #33b kselläññeṣṣe , sakw|sak śpālmeṃ ; trai kleṅkentsa , källoyeṃ ; po saṃsārṣṣi : #33c kauṣentai|kau|(ṣ)entai b1 ra , sanaṃne|sannaṃnne ; snai miyäṣṣälñe|mīyäṣlñe , ṣek tākoym ; po cmelane : 33 #33d paikalñesa|paiykalñesa , paśyavārg«†ä» ; aiśamñeṣṣeṃ , astari|āstr= eśane|eśne ; källoyeṃ|källo(ṃ) onolmi|wnolm(i :) #34a p(i)ś antseṃts|(ā)nt(seṃ)|tsä b2 , ṣañäññe ; sa«ṃ»sāräntse , yolaiññe ; lkoyeṃ auspa : #34b viparyāsṣe , surmesa|sūrmesa ; mā ṣ wāloytär|wāloyträ , piś cmelaṣṣeṃts|cmelṣeṃts ; ek pälskoṣṣe : #34c śtwāra|śtwār= emprenma , lkātsisa|lk(ā)|tsisa b3 ; aiśamñeṣṣi , tākoyeṃ ; śpālmeṃ eśane|eśne : 34 #34d k_uce paikāmai|paiykāmai , pāpavārg«†ä» ; po yolaiññe|yolaiñe , wikäṣṣim_(Opt.)|wīkäṣṣim ; po cmelane : #35a po b4 (kre)nt(au)naṃts , yātatsiśc|yātatsiś ; cämpim_(Opt.)|cämpim palsko , yātässi ; po preściyaṃne|preśyaṃne : #35b k_use poyśintse , watkäṣṣälñe|watkäṣlñe ; kektseñ reki , palskosa ; tukne stamoym|stamo|(ym) b5 #35c (yärp)ontasa , ontsoyätte|ontsoyte ; tarya witsakaṃ|witskaṃ , nautästsiśc|nautässiś ; {ṣ}ek speltkessu|sp{e}lkessu : 35 #35d paikalñesa|paiykalñesa , yugavārg«†ä» ; akālkäntse , knelñe se ; nemcek b6 tākoyeṃ-ñ|(tākoy-ñ #36a bha)vākarñai , poyś(i)ññeṃ ; kauṃ-ñäkteṃts|kau-ñäktentso , pärkālñe ; triśim manta : #36b ñumka ṣkas|ṣkasso , yaknentsa ; ostmeṃ lalñe , pärnāññeṃts|pärnāññets ; mā ārttoymar #36c

Translations from [[Schmidt KT 1974]]
Lines Translation Pages
a1-3 Den Peyālavarga habe ich geschrieben [in dem Wunsche]: Die Aussprüche, die mit Gesetzlosigkeit verbunden [sind], möchte ich nicht preisen, möchte ich nicht sagen. Für das Buddhawort [und] die Śāstras möchte ich Eifer zeigen. Fest im Gesetz stehend, möchte ich gern, [und sei es auch nur] einen [einzigen] Tag, leben: Dies Leben [wäre] das beste. Nicht aber möchte ich ich ein hundert Jahre [währendes] Leben, [das] mit Gesetzlosigkeit verbunden [ist], preisen. 170, 454
a3-5 Den Mitravarga habe ich geschrieben [in dem Wunsche]: In allen Geburten möchte ich gute Freunde erlangen. Mit den Weisen, [die] sich für eine gute Sache entschieden [haben], möge mir Zusammenkommen sein. Mit Gemeinen möchte ich nicht Freundschaft schließen/Nicht möchte ich die Gemeinen lieben, um [nicht] alle Tugenden zu verlieren [wtl. zum Verlorengehen aller Tugenden]. Die richtig Überlegenden, die auf sittliche Haltung Drängenden möchten meine Freunde sein. 342, 454-5
b2 Und nicht möge den Fünfgeburten[wesen] das Auge des Verstandes vom Star der Verkehrtheit [des Irrtums] bedeckt werden. 256-7
b3-5 Weil ich den Pāpavarga geschrieben habe, möchte ich alles Böse in allen Geburten vertreiben. Zum Zustandekommen aller (Tugenden) möchte ich fähig sein, [mein] Denken zu allen Zeiten zu bändigen. Was der Befehl des Allerkenners [ist], eben daran möchte ich mit Körper, Wort [und] Denken halten, an (verdienstvollen Werk)en unersättlich [und] stets bemüht, di e drei Wurzeln zu vernichten. 455

Linguistic commentary a6 "But even with sandhi śtwār=emprenma it would not fit the meter." etc.: This is incorrect! śtwār= emprenma has the required 4 syllables and is attested as such in b2 and [[PK NS 27]] a1! -Martin (Thu, 2020-02-27, 19:33:00)
A complete leaf but without the leaf number preserved. It is immediately followed by [[PK AS 5D]].

div.p: Linguistic commentary "But even with sandhi śtwār=emprenma it would not fit the meter." etc.: This is incorrect! śtwār= emprenma has the required 4 syllables and is attested as such in and ! -Martin (Thu, 2020-02-27, 19:33:00)
